question_sentence: About how much was the equipment the U.S. left behind in Afghanistan worth?
Hurricane Ida was so powerful it:
choices: Created typhoons in the Gulf of Mexico
Reversed the flow of the Mississippi River

question_sentence: After almost 20 years in Afghanistan, the last U.S. soldier left the country. Who was it?
choices: Marine Corps Gen. Kenneth F. McKenzie Jr.
Air Force Gen. John E. Hyten

question_sentence: A mom was called a “hero” by California state officials after protecting her son from:
Vehicle thefts increased by more than 10% in 2020. How many thefts were reported, according to the National Insurance Crime Bureau?
Which of these veteran NFL quarterbacks was surprisingly cut this week?
Experts say taking an antibody test is a good and precise way to find out how protected someone is against COVID-19.
Which of these TV celebrities isn’t one of the 10 most requested TV celebrities on the Cameo in 2021?
China has announced restrictions on gaming for children this week, limiting them to:
choices: Three hours of online gaming per week
Online games hosted on government servers

question_sentence: General Motors will temporarily halt production at nearly all of its North American plants because of:
choices: A defect in assembly line machines
A shortage of semiconductor chips overseas
A shortage of fabric made to craft seats

question_sentence: With which football club has Cristiano Ronaldo signed a two-year deal reportedly worth around £400,000 a week?
evidence: Ronaldo is returning to Old Trafford after making his Manchester United debut in 2003

question_sentence: TV chef Nigella Lawson has been accused of coming over ‘all coy’ after removing what word from the name of one of her recipes?
evidence: Lawson argues that the word has ‘taken on a coarser, more cruel connotation’ since she named her Slut Red Raspberries in Chardonnay Jelly recipe in 2002

question_sentence: Global supplies of which drink are at threat of running dry as a result of a tightening of lockdown measures in Vietnam?
evidence: Lockdown measures have tightened in the port of Ho Chi Minh City, from where most of Vietnam’s coffee is exported

question_sentence: The rollout of ‘game-changing’ new anti-cholesterol drug Inclisiran to NHS patients is expected to save how many lives over the next decade?
evidence: Inclisiran normally costs around £2,000 per dose, but manufacturer Novartis has reportedly ‘agreed an undisclosed discount’ for the health service

question_sentence: TikTok has banned videos of which latest viral trend amid injury warnings?
evidence: The online craze involves stacking milk crates in a pyramid and trying to climb them like stairs

question_sentence: A Nazi sympathiser who downloaded bomb-making instructions from the internet has been sentenced to what unusual ‘punishment’?
evidence: The judge told 21-year-old Ben John that he could avoid prison  as long as he reads works by the likes of Jane Austen, William Shakespeare, Thomas Hardy and Charles Dickens

question_sentence: The UK-based Cov-boost study is exploring the use of how many types of Covid vaccine to discover which are most effective as booster jabs?
evidence: The vaccines being trialled are the Oxford-AstraZeneca, Pfizer-BioNTech, Moderna, Novavax and Johnson & Johnson jabs, as well as French vaccine candidate Valneva and the first-generation vaccine candidate from Curevac

question_sentence: The University of Oxford’s vice-chancellor has said she is ‘embarrassed’ to have which current cabinet member as an alumnus?
evidence: Professor Louise Richardson’s comment was prompted by Gove’s infamous claim in 2016 that people have ‘had enough of experts’

question_sentence: Ministers have rejected a BBC plea for the cost of its licence fee to keep up with inflation over the next how many years?
evidence: The fee currently stands at £159 and has kept up with inflation in the past, but the government is concerned about increases in the cost of living

question_sentence: The US withdrawal from Afghanistan has seen Joe Biden’s approval ratings plummet as the president gears up for midterm elections due to take place when?
evidence: The mid-terms are held at the midpoint of a president's four-year term, on the Tuesday after the first Monday in November
